summary: This document is an email chain from August 9, 2019, between a CNBC reporter and a spokesperson for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The reporter inquires about an investigation into allegations that Jeffrey Epstein misappropriated funds from Les Wexner and his family, and that Epstein's $46 million donation to Wexner's charity was a fraction of the money taken. The DOJ spokesperson declines to comment on ongoing investigative matters.

persons.name: Daniel Mangan
persons.context: CNBC reporter who sent an inquiry to the U.S. Attorney's Office about allegations of financial misappropriation by Jeffrey Epstein involving Les Wexner.

persons.name: Brian Schwartz
persons.context: CNBC journalist copied on the email inquiry regarding Epstein and Wexner.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the inquiry; alleged to have misappropriated funds from Les Wexner and his family.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Founder of L Brands; his legal team allegedly turned over documentation claiming Epstein misappropriated funds from him and his family.

connections.description: Epstein is alleged to have misappropriated funds from Wexner and his family, with a $46 million donation to Wexner's charity cited as a fraction of the money taken.

events.title: CNBC Inquiry on Epstein-Wexner Financial Allegations
events.description: CNBC reporter Daniel Mangan sends an inquiry to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding allegations that Jeffrey Epstein misappropriated funds from Les Wexner and his family.

keyFacts: CNBC was preparing a story alleging Jeffrey Epstein misappropriated funds from Les Wexner and his family.
The alleged misappropriation included a claim that Epstein's $46 million donation to Wexner's charity was only a fraction of the total money taken.
Les Wexner's legal team reportedly turned over documentation of these claims to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The U.S. Department of Justice spokesperson declined to confirm or comment on any ongoing investigative matters regarding these allegations.
